title: Quechua people
summary: Quechua people (/ˈkɛtʃuə/,[6][7] US also /ˈkɛtʃwɑː/;[8] Spanish: [ˈketʃwa]) or Quecha people, may refer to any of the aboriginal people of South America who speak the Quechua languages, which originated among the Indigenous people of Peru. Although most Quechua speakers are native to Peru, there are some significant populations in Ecuador, Bolivia, Chile, Colombia, and Argentina.
